channel.title: 10 - Reference on Fen TTRPG
channel.description: Recent content in 10 - Reference on Fen TTRPG

item.title: Adjacent
item.description:
These are melee weapons, you need to be next to the target to be within range.

Adjacent Weapons

  • Bastard Sword
  • Battleax
  • Bident
  • Buckler
  • Club
  • Curved Blade
  • Dagger
  • Flail
  • Glaive
  • Greatax
  • Greatclub
  • Greatsword
  • Halberd
  • Hammer
  • Handax
  • Heavy Shield
  • Knife

  • Maul
  • Morningstar
  • Pavise
  • Pike
  • Rapier
  • Shield
  • Shortsword
  • Spear
  • Staff
  • Tower Shield
  • Trident
  • War pick
  • Whip

item.title: Aggressive
item.description:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites fight(1d8+)

Description

You gain an additional aggressive action
item.content:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites fight(1d8+)

Description

You gain an additional aggressive action

item.title: Ammunition
item.description:
A weapon’s ammunition. This archetype is used to give a special type of ammunition to long-arms and short-arms. Includes arrows and bullets.

Ammunition
item.content:
A weapon’s ammunition. This archetype is used to give a special type of ammunition to long-arms and short-arms. Includes arrows and bullets.

Ammunition

item.title: Assurance
item.description:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4) per skill
Prerequisites -

Description

Pick a skill your actor has. Increase the number of dice rolled for this skill by 1. For example, if your actor has 1d6 in the Fight skill, after taking this specialization, your actor would roll 2d6 in the Fight skill. Note, once a skill is selected for Assurance it cannot be selected for Talent. This means that once you select Assurance on a skill, you can never increase the sides of the die.
item.content:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4) per skill
Prerequisites -

Description

Pick a skill your actor has. Increase the number of dice rolled for this skill by 1. For example, if your actor has 1d6 in the Fight skill, after taking this specialization, your actor would roll 2d6 in the Fight skill. Note, once a skill is selected for Assurance it cannot be selected for Talent. This means that once you select Assurance on a skill, you can never increase the sides of the die.

item.title: Attack
item.description: You make one melee or ranged attack. See Attacking and Defending.
item.content: You make one melee or ranged attack. See Attacking and Defending.

item.title: Ax
item.description:
A weapon with a short handle and a flat ax head in one or more directions. The ax archetype encompasses throwing axes/hatches, battle axes, woodcutting axes, etc. This archetype does not include polearms with ax heads or cleaver knives.

Ax Weapons

  • Battleax
  • Greatax
  • Handax
  • War pick
item.content:
A weapon with a short handle and a flat ax head in one or more directions. The ax archetype encompasses throwing axes/hatches, battle axes, woodcutting axes, etc. This archetype does not include polearms with ax heads or cleaver knives.

Ax Weapons

  • Battleax
  • Greatax
  • Handax
  • War pick

item.title: Bulwark
item.description: Your armor restricts movement, your dodge is treated as two die increments lower when rolling dodge. You can use armor’s defense to reduce damage of area of effects, your armor does not take damage unless the effect says otherwise.
item.content: Your armor restricts movement, your dodge is treated as two die increments lower when rolling dodge. You can use armor’s defense to reduce damage of area of effects, your armor does not take damage unless the effect says otherwise.

item.title: Close
item.description:
These are generally thrown weapons, they can be used within a close range. If specific positioning is needed close range weapons can be used within 20 to 60 feet.

Close Weapons

  • Dart
  • Hand Crossbow
  • Javelin
item.content:
These are generally thrown weapons, they can be used within a close range. If specific positioning is needed close range weapons can be used within 20 to 60 feet.

Close Weapons

  • Dart
  • Hand Crossbow
  • Javelin

item.title: Clothing
item.description:
Name Def Archetype Traits
Clothing - Unarmored Comfortable

Description

Any type of normal clothing not meant as armor.
item.content:

Clothing - Unarmored Comfortable

item.title: Counter
item.description: Another actor entering your range triggers an attack of opportunity for you.
item.content: Another actor entering your range triggers an attack of opportunity for you.

item.title: Cover
item.description: You cannot be targeted by a ranged attack.
item.content: You cannot be targeted by a ranged attack.

item.title: Cudgel
item.description:
A blunt or heavy weapon used to bludgeon or slam enemies. The cudgel archetype encompasses maces, clubs, heavy clubs, warhammers, great-hammers, sheleighly, etc.

Cudgel Weapons

  • Club
  • Flail
  • Greatclub
  • Hammer
  • Mace
  • Maul
  • Morningstar
  • Staff
item.content:
A blunt or heavy weapon used to bludgeon or slam enemies. The cudgel archetype encompasses maces, clubs, heavy clubs, warhammers, great-hammers, sheleighly, etc.

Cudgel Weapons

  • Club
  • Flail
  • Greatclub
  • Hammer
  • Mace
  • Maul
  • Morningstar
  • Staff

item.description:

Curved Blade 1d6 S 2 Adjacent Short-blade Light

Description

A short curved blade wielded in one hand.

item.title: Extreme
item.description:
These are generally unlimited ranged weapons. They can target anything that the actor can see.

Extreme Weapons
item.content:
These are generally unlimited ranged weapons. They can target anything that the actor can see.

Extreme Weapons

item.title: Heavy
item.description:
This archetype marks the ultimate protective armors. This armor offers good protection with the obstruction of some movement. This archetype of armor is often worn by heavy cavalry and knights. This would include full plate armors.

Heavy Armors

  • Full Plate
  • Half Plate
item.content:
This archetype marks the ultimate protective armors. This armor offers good protection with the obstruction of some movement. This archetype of armor is often worn by heavy cavalry and knights. This would include full plate armors.

Heavy Armors

  • Full Plate
  • Half Plate

item.title: Hidden
item.description: While hidden in this way, you cannot be targeted.
item.content: While hidden in this way, you cannot be targeted.

item.title: Immediate
item.description: The Immediate keyword allows for a specialization to be purchased at any time. Normally specializations must be purchased outside of any combat encounter, this keyword allows the specialization to be purchased during the heat of combat and any other time. The effects of the specialization take place immediately as per the text of the specialization description. The description of the specialization will specific the action cost if any.
item.content: The Immediate keyword allows for a specialization to be purchased at any time. Normally specializations must be purchased outside of any combat encounter, this keyword allows the specialization to be purchased during the heat of combat and any other time. The effects of the specialization take place immediately as per the text of the specialization description. The description of the specialization will specific the action cost if any.

item.title: Knife Fighter
item.description:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites -

Description

You gain an additional die when rolling damage using a weapon with the short-blade archetype. The type of die is determined by the default sides of the weapon. For example, a standard Dagger has a weapon die of 1d4. When rolling damage after taking this specialization you instead roll 2d4. If, instead, the weapon had multiple default weapon dice you only add one additional die of the highest sides. If a weapon by default rolls 1d4+2d6+3d8 you gain an additional 1d8 after taking this specialization. This specialization applies to offhanded weapons as well.
item.content:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites -

Description

You gain an additional die when rolling damage using a weapon with the short-blade archetype. The type of die is determined by the default sides of the weapon. For example, a standard Dagger has a weapon die of 1d4. When rolling damage after taking this specialization you instead roll 2d4. If, instead, the weapon had multiple default weapon dice you only add one additional die of the highest sides. If a weapon by default rolls 1d4+2d6+3d8 you gain an additional 1d8 after taking this specialization. This specialization applies to offhanded weapons as well.

item.title: Light
item.description:
A light weapon can add its damage die to a damage roll when wielded in an off hand. If the light weapon has the Loaded(X) trait, adding the damage die costs ammunition as if you shot the weapon. If the light weapon is a ranged weapon and is used in melee, this provokes and attack of opportunity as normal.

In addition, light weapons can be counseled on an actor’s person.
item.content:
A light weapon can add its damage die to a damage roll when wielded in an off hand. If the light weapon has the Loaded(X) trait, adding the damage die costs ammunition as if you shot the weapon. If the light weapon is a ranged weapon and is used in melee, this provokes and attack of opportunity as normal.

In addition, light weapons can be counseled on an actor’s person.

item.title: Light Armor
item.description:
This archetype encompasses all armors that offer light protection with minimal obstruction of movement, often worn by archers or thieves. Leather armor, such as simple gambesons or padding, might also include small hauberks or other light chain shirts that don’t cover the whole torso.

Light Armors

  • Leather
  • Padded Armor
  • Studded Leather
item.content:
This archetype encompasses all armors that offer light protection with minimal obstruction of movement, often worn by archers or thieves. Leather armor, such as simple gambesons or padding, might also include small hauberks or other light chain shirts that don’t cover the whole torso.

Light Armors

  • Leather
  • Padded Armor
  • Studded Leather

item.title: Load
item.description:
1 aggressive action

You load ammunition into a weapon with the Loaded weapon trait. The number of ammunition loaded into the weapon is specified by its Loaded trait.
item.content:
1 aggressive action

You load ammunition into a weapon with the Loaded weapon trait. The number of ammunition loaded into the weapon is specified by its Loaded trait.

item.title: Loaded(X)
item.description: This weapon uses ammunition to make a ranged attack. Each time you use the weapon to attack you expend one piece of ammunition. The X property is the amount of ammunition you can fire before needing to reload using the Load aggressive action. A loading property of zero (0) means that you can draw the ammunition and fire the weapon as part of one aggressive action.
item.content: This weapon uses ammunition to make a ranged attack. Each time you use the weapon to attack you expend one piece of ammunition. The X property is the amount of ammunition you can fire before needing to reload using the Load aggressive action. A loading property of zero (0) means that you can draw the ammunition and fire the weapon as part of one aggressive action.

item.title: Long
item.description:
These are generally ranged weapons that are designed for battle/war type engagements. If specific position is needed long range weapons can be used within 80 to 320 feet.

Long Weapons

  • Heavy Crossbow
  • Light Crossbow
  • Longbow
item.content:
These are generally ranged weapons that are designed for battle/war type engagements. If specific position is needed long range weapons can be used within 80 to 320 feet.

Long Weapons

  • Heavy Crossbow
  • Light Crossbow
  • Longbow

item.title: Long-arm
item.description: A weapon used with precision in short to long range engagements. The focus of these weapons is in precision and one needs to be trained for accuracy. We lump bows and rifles into one archetype because their archetypes are similar (i.e., precision based weapons with high skill ceilings). Note: not all ages have rifles. Note: This archetype include both short and long bows, rifles of all kinds, and other precision-focused ranged weapons.
item.content:
A weapon used with precision in short to long range engagements. The focus of these weapons is in precision and one needs to be trained for accuracy. We lump bows and rifles into one archetype because their archetypes are similar (i.e., precision based weapons with high skill ceilings). Note: not all ages have rifles. Note: This archetype include both short and long bows, rifles of all kinds, and other precision-focused ranged weapons.

Long-arm Weapon

  • Heavy Crossbow
  • Light Crossbow
  • Longbow
  • Shortbow

item.title: Long-blade
item.description:
A long bladed weapon used in both piercing and slashing. The long blade archetype encompasses all swords and great-swords.

Long Blade Weapons

  • Bastard Sword
  • Greatsword
  • Longsword
item.content:
A long bladed weapon used in both piercing and slashing. The long blade archetype encompasses all swords and great-swords.

Long Blade Weapons

  • Bastard Sword
  • Greatsword
  • Longsword

item.title: Manuscripts and Codices
item.description:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites -

Description

You gain an additional die when rolling damage using a weapon with the long-blade archetype. The type of die is determined by the default sides of the weapon. For example, a standard Longsword has a weapon die of 1d8. When rolling damage after taking this specialization you instead roll 2d8. If, instead, the weapon had multiple default weapon dice you only add one additional die of the highest sides. If a weapon by default rolls 1d4+2d6+3d8 you gain an additional 1d8 after taking this specialization. This specialization applies to offhanded weapons as well.
item.content:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites -

Description

You gain an additional die when rolling damage using a weapon with the long-blade archetype. The type of die is determined by the default sides of the weapon. For example, a standard Longsword has a weapon die of 1d8. When rolling damage after taking this specialization you instead roll 2d8. If, instead, the weapon had multiple default weapon dice you only add one additional die of the highest sides. If a weapon by default rolls 1d4+2d6+3d8 you gain an additional 1d8 after taking this specialization. This specialization applies to offhanded weapons as well.

item.title: Medium Armor
item.description:
This archetype marks the middle ground between light and heavy armors. It offers good protection without obstructing too much movement, considered to be a compromise. Often this archetype is worn by light cavalry and men-at-arms This would include full chain shirts, partial plates and enclosed helmets.

Medium Armors

  • Chain Mail
  • Hide Armor
  • Partial Plate
  • Scale Mail
item.content:
This archetype marks the middle ground between light and heavy armors. It offers good protection without obstructing too much movement, considered to be a compromise. Often this archetype is worn by light cavalry and men-at-arms This would include full chain shirts, partial plates and enclosed helmets.

Medium Armors

  • Chain Mail
  • Hide Armor
  • Partial Plate
  • Scale Mail

item.title: Metallic
item.description: The armor is made of metal and can rust.
item.content: The armor is made of metal and can rust.

item.title: Noisy
item.description: You can not have the hidden condition while wearing this armor. Some spells might overcome this trait.
item.content: You can not have the hidden condition while wearing this armor. Some spells might overcome this trait.

item.title: Opportunity Attack
item.description: You may use your reaction to make a melee attack against an actor within your range that uses a Use Unequipped Item aggressive action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves your melee range. Roll a melee attack against the triggering actor as per the Attack aggressive action.
item.content: You may use your reaction to make a melee attack against an actor within your range that uses a Use Unequipped Item aggressive action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves your melee range. Roll a melee attack against the triggering actor as per the Attack aggressive action.

item.title: Plant Weapon
item.description:
1 passive action

You place a weapon with the Planted trait on the ground in front of you. While standing adjacent to the weapon, you gain the condition Cover.
item.content:
1 passive action

You place a weapon with the Planted trait on the ground in front of you. While standing adjacent to the weapon, you gain the condition Cover.

item.title: Planted
item.description: While wielding this weapon you gain the passive action Plant Weapon.
item.content: While wielding this weapon you gain the passive action Plant Weapon.

item.title: Polearm
item.description:
A weapon that is a long stick ended in a blade/weapon head. The polearm archetype encompasses all polearms including spears.

Polearm Weapons

  • Bident
  • Glaive
  • Halberd
  • Lance
  • Pike
  • Spear
  • Trident
item.content:
A weapon that is a long stick ended in a blade/weapon head. The polearm archetype encompasses all polearms including spears.

Polearm Weapons

  • Bident
  • Glaive
  • Halberd
  • Lance
  • Pike
  • Spear
  • Trident

item.title: Reactive
item.description:
g
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites dodge(1d8+)
ation-front >}}

Description

You gain an additional reacti
item.content:
g
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable(4)
Prerequisites dodge(1d8+)
ation-front >}}

Description

You gain an additional reacti

item.title: Repeatable
item.description: The Repeatable keyword allows for a specialization to be purchased multiple times. A specialization marked as Repeatable can be bought any number of times for one actor. A specialization marked as Repeatable(X), where X is some whole number, represents that a specialization can be taken a maximum of X number of times. The sp cost of a Repeatable specialization increases each time you purchase it. Unless otherwise stated in the specialization, the cost is equal to the base cost times the total number of Repeatable an actor will have after purchasing the specialization. For example, if an actor has a Repeatable specialization that originally cost 100 sp, the actor would have to spend 200 sp to take the specialization again. If they instead had taken the Repeatable specialization two times, they would have to spend 300 sp to purchase the specialization again.
item.content: The Repeatable keyword allows for a specialization to be purchased multiple times. A specialization marked as Repeatable can be bought any number of times for one actor. A specialization marked as Repeatable(X), where X is some whole number, represents that a specialization can be taken a maximum of X number of times. The sp cost of a Repeatable specialization increases each time you purchase it. Unless otherwise stated in the specialization, the cost is equal to the base cost times the total number of Repeatable an actor will have after purchasing the specialization. For example, if an actor has a Repeatable specialization that originally cost 100 sp, the actor would have to spend 200 sp to take the specialization again. If they instead had taken the Repeatable specialization two times, they would have to spend 300 sp to purchase the specialization again.

item.title: restrictive
item.description: Your armor restricts some movement, your dodge is treated as one die increment lower when rolling dodge.
item.content: Your armor restricts some movement, your dodge is treated as one die increment lower when rolling dodge.

item.title: Shield
item.description:
A shield or shield-like weapon. The primary focus is on defense. The shield archetype encompasses all shields and held defenses.

Shield Weapons

  • Buckler
  • Heavy Shield
  • Pavise
  • Shield
  • Tower Shield
item.content:
A shield or shield-like weapon. The primary focus is on defense. The shield archetype encompasses all shields and held defenses.

Shield Weapons

  • Buckler
  • Heavy Shield
  • Pavise
  • Shield
  • Tower Shield

item.title: Short
item.description:
These are generally ranged weapons that are designed for skirmish type engagements. If specific positioning is needed short range weapons can be used within 30 to 120 feet.

Short Weapons

  • Blowgun
  • Shortbow
  • Sling
item.content:
These are generally ranged weapons that are designed for skirmish type engagements. If specific positioning is needed short range weapons can be used within 30 to 120 feet.

Short Weapons

  • Blowgun
  • Shortbow
  • Sling

item.title: Short-arm
item.description:
A weapon used at range within proximity of melee combat. We lump thrown weapons and pistols into one archetype because their archetypes are similar (i.e., ranged weapon in close quarters). Note: not all ages have pistols. This archetype includes all thrown weapons and all pistols.

Short-arm Weapons

  • Blowgun
  • Dart
  • Hand Crossbow
  • Javelin
  • Sling
item.content:
A weapon used at range within proximity of melee combat. We lump thrown weapons and pistols into one archetype because their archetypes are similar (i.e., ranged weapon in close quarters). Note: not all ages have pistols. This archetype includes all thrown weapons and all pistols.

Short-arm Weapons

  • Blowgun
  • Dart
  • Hand Crossbow
  • Javelin
  • Sling

item.title: Short-Blade
item.description:
A short bladed weapon used for both piercing and slashing. The short blade archetype encompasses all knives and daggers.

Short-blade Weapons

  • Curved Blade
  • Dagger
  • Knife
  • Rapier
  • Shortsword
item.content:
A short bladed weapon used for both piercing and slashing. The short blade archetype encompasses all knives and daggers.

Short-blade Weapons

  • Curved Blade
  • Dagger
  • Knife
  • Rapier
  • Shortsword

item.title: Talent
item.description:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable
Prerequisites -

Description

Select a skill your actor has that was not selected by the Assurance specialization. Increase its die by one increment.
item.content:
Cost 0 sp
Traits Repeatable
Prerequisites -

Description

Select a skill your actor has that was not selected by the Assurance specialization. Increase its die by one increment.

item.title: Thrown(X)
item.description: You can throw a weapon with the thrown trait. When throwing this weapon you can use either fight or dodge as skill die for the damage roll. You can throw this weapon in X range. Thrown weapons gain the short-arm archetype in addition to all other archetypes.
item.content: You can throw a weapon with the thrown trait. When throwing this weapon you can use either fight or dodge as skill die for the damage roll. You can throw this weapon in X range. Thrown weapons gain the short-arm archetype in addition to all other archetypes.

item.title: Two-handed
item.description: This weapon takes two hands to wield.
item.content: This weapon takes two hands to wield.

item.title: Unarmored
item.description:
This archetype encompasses any clothing that is worn as “armor” but isn’t considered to be classical armor. For example, monk’s vestments, decorative bear-pelts, and wizard’s robes all fall into the unarmored archetype.

Unarmored Armor

  • Clothing
  • Robes
item.content:
This archetype encompasses any clothing that is worn as “armor” but isn’t considered to be classical armor. For example, monk’s vestments, decorative bear-pelts, and wizard’s robes all fall into the unarmored archetype.

Unarmored Armor

  • Clothing
  • Robes

item.title: Use Unequipped Item
item.description: Use or interact with an item that is marked in one of the stored slots.
item.content: Use or interact with an item that is marked in one of the stored slots.

item.title: Versatile(X)
item.description: Versatile trait allows an actor to pick from either the default weapon damage type or X damage type. This choice is applied when rolling damage and does not take any action.
item.content: Versatile trait allows an actor to pick from either the default weapon damage type or X damage type. This choice is applied when rolling damage and does not take any action.

item.title: Whip
item.description:
A whip or whip-like weapon. The whip archetype is narrow and more focused on mobility or control than damage.

Whip Weapons

  • Whip
item.content:
A whip or whip-like weapon. The whip archetype is narrow and more focused on mobility or control than damage.

Whip Weapons

  • Whip
